metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14174 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In coders/psd.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-0 Q16, a DoS inReadPSDLayersInternal() due to lack of an EOF (End of File) check mightcause huge CPU consumption. When a crafted PSD file, which claims a large"length" field in the header but does not contain sufficient backing data,is provided, the loop over "length" would consume huge CPU resources, sincethere is no EOF check inside the loop.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14174` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11').
